other.name: Computational Mastermind
other.description: At the end of your Command phase, before you determine if units from your army have Hostile Acquisition or Fortify Takeover, for each objective marker you control that has one or more models with this ability within range of it, you can spend 1YP or gain 1YP.

other.name: Predictive Guidance
other.description: Once per battle round, this model can use this ability. If it does, you can target this unit with the Fire Overwatch or Heroic Intervention Stratagem for 0CP.

datasheets.fluff: Memnyr Strategists are superlative martial tacticians. They offer tactical insights to outmanoeuvre the foe and map the enemy’s vulnerabilities. They can extrapolate a foe’s plans so well that their advice borders supernatural precognition, enabling the Kin to strike devastating blows when least expected.
datasheets.leader: This model can be attached to the following units: ■ IRONKIN STEELJACKS WITH HEAVY VOLKANITE DISINTEGRATORS ■ IRONKIN STEELJACKS WITH MELEE WEAPONS
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: Autoch‑pattern bolt pistol; close combat weapon.
datasheets.name: Memnyr Strategist
wargear: None

units: IRONKIN STEELJACKS WITH HEAVY VOLKANITE DISINTEGRATORS

other.name: Decisive Destruction
other.description: Each time a model in this unit makes a ranged attack that targets the closest eligible target, re‑roll a Hit roll of 1.

wargear.name: Weavefield crest
wargear.description: Models in the bearer’s unit have a 5+ invulnerable save.

wargear.name: Teleport Crest
wargear.description: Models in the bearer’s unit have the Deep Strike ability.

datasheets.fluff: Clad in formidable exoarmour and equipped with a fearsome array of weaponry, Einhyr Hearthguard are a force to be reckoned with. Whether forming bodyguards around their oathband’s heroes or striking deep into the heart of enemy territory, they are unstoppable on the attack and immovable in defence.
datasheets.loadout:
Every model is equipped with: EtaCarn plasma gun; exoarmour grenade launcher; concussion gauntlet.
The Hesyr is additionally equipped with: weavefield crest.
datasheets.name: Einhyr Hearthguard
wargear: The Hesyr’s weavefield crest can be replaced with 1 teleport crest.
The Hesyr’s concussion gauntlet or plasma blade gauntlet can be replaced with 1 graviton hammer.
All models in this unit can each have their concussion gauntlet replaced with 1 plasma blade gauntlet.
All models in this unit can each have their EtaCarn plasma gun replaced with 1 volkanite disintegrator.

other.name: Fortify (Psychic)
other.description: While this unit is leading a unit, models in that unit have the Feel No Pain 5+ ability.

other.name: Grimnyr’s Regard
other.description: Once per battle, at the start of any phase, you can select one friendly LEAGUES OF VOTANN unit that is Battle‑shocked and within 12" of this unit’s GRIMNYR model. That unit is no longer Battle‑shocked.

composition: If this unit’s Grimnyr model is ever destroyed, all of this unit’s remaining CORV models are also destroyed. While embarking within a TRANSPORT and while embarked within a TRANSPORT, each CORV model takes up the space of 0 models.*
datasheets.fluff: The Grimnyr – or Living Ancestors – are privy to the wisdom of the Votann and as close to priests as the secular Kin get. Equipped with barrier tech such as ward staves and energy‑focusing CORVs, they can rouse the fury of the Immaterium against their foes.
datasheets.leader: This unit can be attached to the following unit: ■ HEARTHKYN WARRIORS
datasheets.loadout:
The Grimnyr is equipped with: Ancestral Wrath; ancestral ward stave.
Every CORV is equipped with: Autoch‑pattern bolter; close combat weapon.
datasheets.name: Grimnyr
wargear: None

other.name: Outflanking Mag-Riders
other.description: At the end of your opponent’s turn, if this unit is wholly within 9" of one or more battlefield edges and not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units, you can remove it from the battlefield and place it into Strategic Reserves.

wargear.name: Multiwave Comms Array
wargear.description: Each time you target the bearer’s unit with a Stratagem, roll one D6: on a 5+, you gain 1CP.

wargear.name: Panspectral Scanner
wargear.description: Each time a model in the bearer’s unit makes a ranged attack, re‑roll a Hit roll of 1.

wargear.name: Rollbar Searchlight
wargear.description: Each time a model in the bearer’s unit makes a ranged attack, you can ignore any or all modifiers to the Hit roll.

datasheets.fluff: Hernkyn Pioneers skim across alien worlds and scout enemy positions, riding on their magna‑coil bikes. Fast, resilient, and possessed of formidable firepower, these far‑ranging bands of warriors often strike at the foe from unexpected quarters or send back intelligence on enemy movements to their oathband’s commanders.
datasheets.loadout: Every model is equipped with: bolt revolver; bolt shotgun; magna-coil autocannon; plasma knife.
datasheets.name: Hernkyn Pioneers
wargear: 1 model that is not equipped with either a HYLas rotary cannon or an ion beamer can be equipped with 1 rollbar searchlight.    A model can only take one of these options, and cannot be equipped with a HYLas rotary cannon or an ion beamer.
1 model that is not equipped with either a HYLas rotary cannon or an ion beamer can be equipped with 1 panspectral scanner. *
1 model that is not equipped with either a HYLas rotary cannon or an ion beamer can be equipped with 1 multiwave comms array. *
For every 3 models in this unit, 1 model can be equipped with one of the following: ◦ 1 HYLas rotary cannon ◦ 1 ion beamer

other.name: Destabilising Quakes
other.description: In your Shooting phase, after this unit has shot, select one enemy unit hit by one or more of those attacks made with its tremor shells. That unit must take a Battle‑shock test, subtracting 1 from the result.

other.name: Geomantic Hunters
other.description:
Up to twice per battle, in your Shooting phase, when this unit is selected to shoot, it can use this ability. If it does, until the end of the phase, each time a model in this unit makes an attack with its breacher ordnance, you can re-roll the Wound roll.

Designer’s Note: Place two breacher ordnance tokens next to the unit, removing one each time this unit uses this ability.

datasheets.fluff: Earthshakers undermine enemy positions with subterranean artillery fire. Some batteries use tremor shells to destabilise strongpoints with deadly quakes. Breacher ordnance, meanwhile, drills to the surface before detonating in a storm of shrapnel, whilst those payloads which initially fail to lock onto their targets hunt them down using geomantic echolocation.
datasheets.loadout: Every model is equipped with: 2 Autoch‑pattern bolt pistols, breacher ordnance; plasma picks.
datasheets.name: Cthonian Earthshakers
wargear: All models in this unit can each have their breacher ordnance replaced with 1 tremor shells.

other.name: Scanner Uplinks
other.description: In your Shooting phase, after this model has shot, select one enemy unit (excluding MONSTERS and VEHICLES) hit by one or more of those attacks. Until the start of your next turn, that enemy unit is suppressed. While a unit is suppressed, each time a model in that unit makes an attack, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.

wargear.name: Smoke Launcher
wargear.description: The bearer has the SMOKE keyword.

datasheets.fluff: A variant of the adaptable Kapricus design, the Carrier provides elite teams of Hernkyn Yaegirs with the means to penetrate enemy lines at speed. The transport’s quad magna‑coils grant it the manoeuvrability to traverse almost any frontier terrain. At the same time, its banks of scanner uplinks enable it to lay down withering hails of accurate, suppressive fire to purge claim sites.
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: magna‑coil autocannon; twin magna‑coil autocannon; armoured hull.
datasheets.name: Kapricus Carrier
datasheets.transport:
This model has a transport capacity of 5 HERNKYN YAEGIR models.

At the start of the Declare Battle Formations step, you can select one HERNKYN YAEGIR unit from your army that has not been split. If you do, that unit is split into two units, each containing as equal a number of models as possible (when splitting a unit in this way, make a note of which models form each of the two new units). One of these units must start the battle embarked within this TRANSPORT; the other can start the battle embarked within another TRANSPORT, or it can be deployed as a separate unit.
wargear: This model can be equipped with 1 smoke launcher.

other.name: Purge Response
other.description: Each time you target this unit with the Fire Overwatch Stratagem, hits are scored on unmodified Hit rolls of 5+ while resolving that Stratagem. If units from your army have Fortify Takeover, hits are scored on unmodified Hit rolls of 4+ while resolving that Stratagem instead.

wargear.name: Preymark Crest
wargear.description: Each time a model in the bearer’s unit makes an attack that targets an enemy unit within range of one or more objective markers, on a Critical Wound, that attack has the [PRECISION] ability.

datasheets.fluff: Gifted by the Votann with innate martial talents, Ironkin Steeljacks are natural soldiers. They can anchor entire battle lines, shrugging off enemy firepower that would fell lesser Kin. When on the offensive, they unleash precision salvoes of searing volkanite beams that scour chosen foes from sites of value to their kindred.
keywords: Ironkin Steeljacks with Heavy Volkanite Disintegrators
datasheets.loadout:
The Steeljack Theyn is equipped with: heavy volkanite disintegrator; plasma knife; preymark crest.
Every Ironkin Steeljack is equipped with: heavy volkanite disintegrator; plasma knife.
datasheets.name: Ironkin Steeljacks with Heavy Volkanite Disintegrators
wargear: The Steeljack Theyn’s heavy volkanite disintegrator and plasma knife can be replaced with 1 Autoch‑pattern bolter and 1 plasma sword.

damaged.description: While this model has 1-5 wounds remaining, each time this model makes an attack, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.

other.name: MultiCOG Targeting
other.description: Each time this model makes a ranged attack, you can ignore any or all modifiers to the following: that attack’s Ballistic Skill characteristic; the Hit roll.

wargear.name: Panspectral Scanner
wargear.description: Each time a model in the bearer’s unit makes a ranged attack, re‑roll a Hit roll of 1.

datasheets.fluff: The iconic battle tank and armoured transport of the Leagues of Votann, the Hekaton Land Fortress is as venerable and well‑respected as it is powerful. With a fearsome arsenal of heavy weaponry, tremendously resilient armour, and the ability to bear bands of Kin soldiery into battle, it is a versatile military asset.
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: cyclic ion cannon; MATR autocannon; 2 twin bolt cannons; armoured wheels; pan spectral scanner.
datasheets.name: Hekaton Land Fortress

abilities.name: Conversion
abilities.description: Each time an attack made with this weapon targets a unit more than 12" from the bearer, an unmodified successful Hit roll of 4+ scores a Critical Hit.

abilities.name: One Shot
abilities.description: The bearer can only shoot with this weapon once per battle.

datasheets.transport: This model has a transport capacity of 14 LEAGUES OF VOTANN INFANTRY models. Each EXOARMOUR, EXOFRAME or IRONKIN STEELJACKS model takes up the space of 2 models.
wargear: This model’s panspectral scanner can be replaced with 1 Hekaton warhead.
This model’s cyclic ion cannon can be replaced with one of the following: ◦ 1 SP heavy conversion beamer ◦ 1 heavy magna-rail cannon
This model’s 2 twin bolt cannons can be replaced with one of the following: ◦ 1 twin bolt cannon and 1 twin ion beamer ◦ 2 twin ion beamers

other.name: Grudge‑fuelled Fortitude
other.description: The first time this model is destroyed, at the end of the phase, roll one D6: on a 2+, set this model back up on the battlefield as close as possible to where it was destroyed and not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units, with its full wounds remaining.

other.name: Unhinged Vengeance
other.description: In your opponent’s Shooting phase, each time an enemy unit has shot, if this model lost one or more wounds as a result of those attacks, this model can make a Vengeance move. To do so, roll one D6 and add 2 to the result: it moves a number of inches up to this result, but it must end that move as close as possible to the closest enemy unit (excluding AIRCRAFT). When doing so, it can be moved within Engagement Range of that enemy unit. This model cannot make a Vengeance move while it is Battle‑shocked or within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units, and can only make one Vengeance move per phase.

datasheets.fluff: Buri Aegnirssen surges into the foe with the ferocious abandon of one with nothing left to lose. With sweeps of his adaptable darkstar glaive, Bane, this inveterate survivor carves a bloody path through the enemy. Not even the most monstrous prey can evade the colossal reach of the Thrice‑devoured’s vengeance.
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: Autoch‑pattern bolt pistol; Bane.
datasheets.name: Buri Aegnirssen
wargear: None

other.name: Brôkhyr Guild Support
other.description: While this unit is within 3" of one or more friendly LEAGUES OF VOTANN VEHICLE or IRONKIN STEELJACKS units, if this unit is not an Attached unit, it has the Lone Operative ability.

other.name: Multispectral Visor
other.description: Each time a model in this unit makes a ranged attack, re‑roll a Wound roll of 1.

other.name: Forgewrought Expertise
other.description: At the end of your Movement phase, this unit can repair one friendly LEAGUES OF VOTANN VEHICLE, EXOFRAME or IRONKIN STEELJACKS unit within 3" of it. One model in that unit regains up to D3 lost wounds, or up to 3 lost wounds instead if this unit contains an Ironkin Assistant model. Each unit can only be repaired once per turn.

composition: If this unit’s Brôkhyr Iron‐master model is ever destroyed, all of this unit’s remaining E‐COG models are also destroyed. While embarking within a TRANSPORT and while embarked within a TRANSPORT, each E‐COG model takes up the space of 0 models.*
datasheets.fluff: Iron‑masters are amongst the most accomplished Brôkhyr of their guild. In battle, they maintain damaged war engines and mechanised soldiery, often aided by Ironkin and COG repair crews. These veteran Brôkhyr also bring their most powerful personal creations to war, taking satisfaction in unleashing them upon the foe.
datasheets.leader: This unit can be attached to the following units: ■ HEARTHKYN WARRIORS ■ BRÔKHYR THUNDERKYN
datasheets.loadout:
The Iron-master is equipped with: graviton rifle; graviton hammer.
The Ironkin Assistant is equipped with: las-beam cutter; close combat weapon.
One E-COG is equipped with: Autoch-pattern bolt pistol; close combat weapon.
One other E-COG is equipped with: plasma torch.
One other E-COG is equipped with: manipulator arms.
datasheets.name: Brôkhyr Iron-master
wargear: None

other.name: Merciless Eradication
other.description: Each time an enemy unit (excluding MONSTERS and VEHICLES) that is within Engagement Range of this unit Falls Back, all models in that enemy unit must take a Desperate Escape test. When doing so, if that enemy unit is Battle‑shocked, subtract 1 from each of those tests.

wargear.name: Preymark Crest
wargear.description: Each time a model in the bearer’s unit makes an attack that targets an enemy unit within range of one or more objective markers, on a Critical Wound, that attack has the [PRECISION] ability.

datasheets.fluff: When equipped with oversized plasma swords or concussion gauntlets to match their larger frames, Ironkin Steeljacks excel as piledriving shock troops. Such squads can smash breaches in enemy lines, pulverise the foe’s elite infantry and tear holes in armoured plating and monstrous flesh alike.
datasheets.loadout:
The Steeljack Theyn is equipped with: Autoch‑pattern bolter; plasma sword; preymark crest.
Every Ironkin Steeljack is equipped with: Autoch‑pattern bolter; plasma sword.
datasheets.name: Ironkin Steeljacks with Melee Weapons
wargear: Any number of models in this unit can each have their plasma sword replaced with 1 concussion gauntlet.

other.name: Ancestral Fortune
other.description: Once per turn, you can spend 1YP to change one Hit roll, one Wound roll or one saving throw made for this model to a 6.

other.name: Grim Efficiency
other.description: Once per battle round, when a friendly LEAGUES OF VOTANN unit within 12" of this model is targeted with a Stratagem, this model can use this ability. If it does, reduce the CP cost of that use of that Stratagem by 1CP.

wargear.name: Rampart Crest
wargear.description: While the bearer is leading a unit, models in that unit have a 5+ invulnerable save.

datasheets.fluff: Already one of the most accomplished heroes of the Kin, Kâhl Ûthar the Destined is marked for a truly vaunted fate. Few can assess the foe as swiftly or mercilessly as Ûthar. Once he has the measure of his enemies, he soon cuts them to pieces with the glowing Blade of the Ancestors.
datasheets.leader: This model can be attached to the following units: ■ EINHYR HEARTHGUARD ■ HEARTHKYN WARRIORS
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: volkanite disintegrator; Blade of the Ancestors; rampart crest.
datasheets.name: Ûthar the Destined
wargear: None

other.name: Pragmatic Hunters
other.description: Once per turn, when an enemy unit ends a Normal, Advance or Fall Back move within 9" of this unit, it can make a Normal move of up to D6".

datasheets.fluff: Merciless forward operatives charged with denying crucial assets to the foe, Yaegirs use every weapon and tactic at their disposal to make the ancestors proud. They typically deploy ahead of their prospect or oathband, with assassination and sabotage amongst their unscrupulous strategies, to bleed the strength from their kindred’s foes.
datasheets.loadout: Every model is equipped with: bolt shotgun; close combat weapon.
datasheets.name: Hernkyn Yaegirs
wargear: 1 Hernkyn Yaegir can have its bolt revolver and plasma knife or its bolt shotgun replaced with 1 APM launcher.
1 Hernkyn Yaegir can have its bolt revolver and plasma knife or its bolt shotgun replaced with 1 magna-coil rifle.
All models in this unit can each have their bolt shotgun replaced with 1 bolt revolver and 1 plasma knife.

other.name: Exemplar of the Einhyr
other.description: While this model is leading a unit, add 1 to Advance and Charge rolls made for that unit.

other.name: Mass Driver Accelerators
other.description: Each time this model ends a Charge move, you can select one enemy unit within Engagement Range of this model and roll one D6: on a 2‑5, that enemy unit suffers D3 mortal wounds; on a 6, that enemy unit suffers D3+3 mortal wounds.

wargear.name: Weavefield Crest
wargear.description: The bearer has a 4+ invulnerable save.

wargear.name: Teleport Crest
wargear.description: While the bearer is leading a unit, models in that unit have the Deep Strike ability.

datasheets.fluff: Einhyr Champions wear modified exoarmour fitted with mass drivers. Combined with their formidable close‑quarters weaponry and bulky RAM shields, this wargear transforms them into living battering rams whose accelerated charge hits hard enough to smash clean through armoured fortress gates.
datasheets.leader: This model can be attached to the following unit: ■ EINHYR HEARTHGUARD
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: Autoch-pattern combi-bolter; mass hammer; weavefield crest.
datasheets.name: Einhyr Champion
wargear: This model’s weavefield crest can be replaced with 1 teleport crest.
This model’s mass hammer can be replaced with 1 darkstar axe.

other.name: Breaching Fire
other.description: In your Shooting phase, after this unit has shot, select one enemy unit hit by one or more of those attacks. Until the start of your next Shooting phase, that enemy unit cannot have the Benefit of Cover.

datasheets.fluff: When a Brôkhyr hooks into a powerful exoframe, they become Thunderkyn. Adapted from rigs used to maintain Kin spacecraft, these armoured exoskeletons exchange repair tools for massive heavy weapons, which the Brôkhyr use to lay down withering covering fire for the oathbands and to pick off enemy armour.
datasheets.loadout: Every model is equipped with: bolt cannon; close combat weapon.
datasheets.name: Brôkhyr Thunderkyn

abilities.name: Conversion
abilities.description: Each time an attack made with this weapon targets a unit more than 12" from the bearer, an unmodified successful Hit roll of 4+ scores a Critical Hit.

wargear: All models in this unit can each have their bolt cannon replaced with 1 SP conversion beamer.
All models in this unit can each have their bolt cannon replaced with 1 graviton blast cannon.

other.name: Science Guild Support
other.description: While this model is within 3" of one or more other friendly LEAGUES OF VOTANN INFANTRY units (excluding units with the Lone Operative ability), this model has the Lone Operative ability.

other.name: Resource Transmutation
other.description: Once per turn, in your Shooting phase, one model with this ability can use it when it is selected to shoot. If it does, you must spend 1YP and, until the end of the phase, ranged weapons equipped by that model have the [SUSTAINED HITS 1] ability and, after that model has shot this phase, if one or more enemy units were destroyed by those attacks, you can gain up to 2YP.

datasheets.fluff: Clad in heavy‑duty hauberks to shield them from the worst of their weapons’ emissions, Arkanyst Evaluators unleash deadly experimental energies into the foe. Their transmatter inverters painfully rupture cellular tissue or trigger lethal atomic transformations, all to provide the Evaluator with the field data needed to hone their weapon further.
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: transmatter inverter; close combat weapon.
datasheets.name: Arkanyst Evaluator
wargear: None

other.name: Opportunistic Manoeuvre
other.description: In your Shooting phase, after this unit has shot, it can make a Normal move of up to D6". If it does, until the end of the turn, this unit is not eligible to declare a charge.

wargear.name: Smoke Launcher
wargear.description: The bearer has the SMOKE keyword.

datasheets.fluff: Kapricus Defenders are swift, magna‑coil scouting engines. Heavily armed, some carry magna‑rail cannons that can annihilate battle tanks many times the Defender’s mass. Others carry rapid‑firing rotary cannons, which, paired with a Defender’s magna‑coil autocannons, enable their Hernkyn crew to scythe through enemy infantry to support Kin advances.
datasheets.loadout: Every model is equipped with: magna‑rail cannon; twin magna‑coil autocannon; armoured hull.
datasheets.name: Kapricus Defenders
wargear: Any number of models can each be equipped with 1 smoke launcher.
Any number of models in this unit can each have their magna‑rail cannon replaced with 1 HYLas rotary cannon.

other.name: Cyberstimms
other.description: Each time a model in this unit is destroyed by a melee attack, if that model has not fought this phase, roll one D6, adding 1 to the result if units from your army have Fortify Takeover: on a 4+, do not remove it from play. The destroyed model can fight after the attacking unit has finished making its attacks, and is then removed from play.

other.name: Subterranean Explosives
other.description:
In your Shooting phase, after this unit has shot, select one enemy unit (excluding MONSTERS and VEHICLES) hit by one or more of those attacks made with a mole grenade launcher. Until the start of your next Shooting phase, that enemy unit cannot be targeted with the Fire Overwatch Stratagem.

Designer’s Note: We recommend placing a Mole Grenade token next to that enemy unit as a reminder.

datasheets.fluff: Cthonian Beserks are amongst the most heavily augmented and courageous Kin. Brandishing mining tools that double as weapons of war and unleashing explosives that tunnel through solid rock, the Beserks storm the enemy’s strong points and rupture them as if they were asteroids filled with seams of precious ore.
datasheets.loadout: Every model is equipped with: heavy plasma axe.
datasheets.name: Cthonian Beserks
wargear: For every 5 models in this unit, 1 model that is not equipped with a twin concussion gauntlet or a mole grenade launcher can be equipped with 1 mole grenade launcher.    Designer’s Note: If a Cthonian Beserk is equipped with a mole grenade launcher, it will be accompanied by an L‑COG unit: both models should be placed on the same base and together they act as a single model for all rules purposes.
For every 5 models in this unit, 1 model that is not equipped with a mole grenade launcher can have its heavy plasma axe or concussion maul replaced with 1 twin concussion gauntlet.
All models in this unit can each have their heavy plasma axe replaced with 1 concussion maul.

other.name: Blistering Advance
other.description: Units can disembark from this TRANSPORT after it has Advanced. Units that do so count as having made a Normal move that phase, and cannot declare a charge in the same turn, but can otherwise act normally in the remainder of the turn.

datasheets.fluff: Designed to survive the worst that hostile worlds and alien predators can throw at it, the Sagitaur is a rugged ATV ideally suited to scouting operations and swift, armoured offensives. Sagitaurs mount a remarkable amount of firepower for their size and can even knock out enemy battle tanks.
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: HYLas beam cannon; twin bolt cannon; armoured wheels.
datasheets.name: Sagitaur
datasheets.transport:
This model has a transport capacity of 6 LEAGUES OF VOTANN INFANTRY models. It cannot transport EXOARMOUR, EXOFRAME or IRONKIN STEELJACKS models.

At the start of the Declare Battle Formations step, you can select one HEARTHKYN WARRIORS unit from your army that has not been split. If you do, that unit is split into two units, each containing as equal a number of models as possible (when splitting a unit in this way, make a note of which models form each of the two new units). One of these units must start the battle embarked within this TRANSPORT; the other can start the battle embarked within another TRANSPORT, or it can be deployed as a separate unit.
wargear: This model’s HYLas beam cannon can be replaced with one of the following: ◦ 1 L7 missile launcher and 1 Sagitaur missile launcher ◦ 1 MATR autocannon

other.name: Kindred Hero
other.description: While this model is leading a unit, weapons equipped by models in that unit have the [LETHAL HITS] ability.

other.name: Seized Opportunity
other.description: Once per phase, one model from your army with this ability can use it when its unit destroys an enemy unit. If it does, you gain 1YP.

wargear.name: Rampart Crest
wargear.description: While this model is leading a unit, models in that unit have a 5+ invulnerable save.

wargear.name: Teleport Crest
wargear.description: While this model is leading a unit, models in that unit have the Deep Strike ability.

datasheets.fluff: Most oathbands are led by a Kâhl, whose strategic wisdom, determination and martial might inspire their warriors. Kâhls are often equipped with potent weapons and teleportation technologies, the better to lead the fight from the front and bring down the deadliest foes.
datasheets.leader: This model can be attached to the following units: ■ EINHYR HEARTHGUARD ■ HEARTHKYN WARRIORS
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: Autoch-pattern combi-bolter; forgewrought plasma axe; rampart crest.
datasheets.name: Kâhl
wargear: This model’s rampart crest can be replaced with 1 teleport crest.
This model’s forgewrought plasma axe can be replaced with 1 mass gauntlet.
This model’s Autoch-pattern combi-bolter can be replaced with 1 volkanite disintegrator.

other.name: Luck Has. Need Keeps. Toil Earns.
other.description: At the end of your Command phase, if this unit is within range of an objective marker you control, that objective marker remains under your control until your opponent’s Level of Control over that objective marker is greater than yours at the end of a phase.

other.name: Panspectral Scanning
other.description: Each time a model in this unit makes a ranged attack, re‑roll a Hit roll of 1.

wargear.name: Weavefield crest
wargear.description: Models in the bearer’s unit have a 5+ invulnerable save.

datasheets.fluff: Well‑armoured, well‑trained and equipped with powerful weaponry, Hearthkyn Warriors form the backbone of most oathbands. Led by their Theyns, they lay down hails of firepower, shrugging off the enemy’s return volleys before storming in to shatter their wavering foes for good.
datasheets.loadout:
The Theyn is equipped with: Autoch‑pattern bolt pistol; Autoch‑pattern bolter; close combat weapon; weavefield crest.
Every Hearthkyn Warrior is equipped with: Autoch‑pattern bolt pistol; Autoch‑pattern bolter; close combat weapon.
datasheets.name: Hearthkyn Warriors
wargear: The Theyn can be equipped with 1 Theyn’s melee weapon.
The Theyn’s Autoch-pattern bolter can be replaced with one of the following: ◦ 1 ion blaster ◦ 1 Theyn’s pistol
Up to 2 Hearthkyn Warriors can each have their Autoch‑pattern bolter or ion blaster replaced with 1 plasma knife.

Up to 2 Hearthkyn Warriors can each have their Autoch‑pattern bolter or ion blaster replaced with one of the following (duplicates are not allowed): ◦ 1 HYLas auto rifle ◦ 1 HYLas rotary cannon ◦ 1 L7 missile launcher ◦ 1 EtaCarn plasma beamer ◦ 1 magna‑rail rifle
Any number of Hearthkyn Warriors can each have their Autoch‑pattern bolter replaced with 1 ion blaster.

enhancements.name: Oathbound Speculator
enhancements.description: LEAGUES OF VOTANN model only. Each time a model in the bearer’s unit makes an attack, re‑roll a Wound roll of 1. Each time the bearer’s unit is selected to shoot or fight, you can spend 3YP. If you do, until the end of the phase, each time a model in the bearer’s unit makes an attack, add 1 to the Wound roll.

enhancements.name: Dead Reckoning
enhancements.description: LEAGUES OF VOTANN model only. At the end of the turn, if the bearer is on the battlefield and you spent no YP in that turn, you can gain 1YP.

enhancements.name: Iron Ambassador
enhancements.description: LEAGUES OF VOTANN model equipped with an Autoch‑pattern combi‑bolter only. Once per battle, when the bearer’s unit is selected to shoot, the bearer can use this Enhancement. If it does, spend up to 3YP and, until the end of the phase, add the number of YP you just spent to the Damage characteristic of the bearer’s ranged weapons

enhancements.name: Ancestral Crest
enhancements.description: LEAGUES OF VOTANN model only. Once per turn, when you target the bearer’s unit with the Command Re‑roll Stratagem, the bearer can use this Enhancement. If it does, spend 1YP and reduce the CP cost of that use of that Stratagem by 1CP.

enhancements.name: Bastion Shield
enhancements.description: LEAGUES OF VOTANN model only. Each time a ranged attack targets the bearer’s unit, if the attacking model is within 12" of the bearer’s unit, worsen the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1.

enhancements.name: Quake Multigenerator
enhancements.description: KÂHL model only. In your Shooting phase, after the bearer has shot, select one enemy unit (excluding TITANIC units) hit by one or more of those attacks. Until the start of your next turn, that enemy unit is suppressed. While a unit is suppressed, each time a model in that unit makes an attack, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.

enhancements.name: Ironskein
enhancements.description: LEAGUES OF VOTANN model only. Add 2 to the bearer’s Wounds characteristic.

enhancements.name: High Kâhl
enhancements.description: KÂHL model only. Each time a model in the bearer’s unit is destroyed by a melee attack, if it has not fought this phase, roll one D6: on a 4+, do not remove it from play. The destroyed model can fight after the attacking unit has finished making its attacks, and is then removed from play.

enhancements.name: Eye for Weakness
enhancements.description: LEAGUES OF VOTANN model only. Each time a model in the bearer’s unit makes an attack that targets an assailed unit, add 1 to the Wound roll.

enhancements.name: Writ of Acquisition
enhancements.description: LEAGUES OF VOTANN model only. In your Shooting phase, after the bearer’s unit has shot, you gain 1YP for each assailed enemy unit hit by one or more of those attacks (to a maximum of 3YP).

enhancements.name: Surgical Saboteur
enhancements.description: LEAGUES OF VOTANN model only. In your Shooting phase, after the bearer’s unit has shot, select one MONSTER or VEHICLE unit hit by one or more of those attacks; until the start of your next Shooting phase, that unit is pinned.

enhancements.name: Nomad Strategist
enhancements.description: LEAGUES OF VOTANN model only. Once per battle, at the end of your opponent’s Fight phase, if the bearer is on the battlefield, it can use this Enhancement. If it does, you can spend up to 4YP. Select one HERNKYN unit from your army, and, for every 2YP you just spent, select up to one additional HERNKYN unit from your army. You can remove those units from the battlefield and place them into Strategic Reserves. You cannot select a unit that is within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units (excluding assailed units).

enhancements.name: Dêlvewerke Navigator
enhancements.description: LEAGUES OF VOTANN model only. In the Reinforcements step of your Movement phase, the bearer can use this Enhancement. If it does, select one friendly CTHONIAN BESERKS unit visible to the bearer and then spend any number of YP. Return one destroyed model to that unit and then, for every 2YP you just spent, return up to one additional destroyed model to that unit.

enhancements.name: Multiwave System Jammer
enhancements.description: LEAGUES OF VOTANN model only. Once per battle, in your Movement phase, if the bearer is on the battlefield, it can use this Enhancement. If it does, select one friendly CTHONIAN unit that is in Reserves. Until the end of the phase, for the purposes of setting up that unit on the battlefield, treat the current battle round number as being one higher than it actually is.

enhancements.name: Quake Supervisor
enhancements.description: LEAGUES OF VOTANN model only. While the bearer is within 3" of one or more friendly LEAGUES OF VOTANN ARTILLERY units, the bearer has the Lone Operative ability, and each time one of those ARTILLERY units makes a ranged attack that targets an enemy unit visible to the bearer, add 1 to the Hit roll.

enhancements.name: Piledriver
enhancements.description: LEAGUES OF VOTANN model only. Each time the bearer’s unit is selected to fight, the bearer can use this Enhancement. If it does, spend up to 2YP and, until the end of the phase, add the number of YP you just spent to the Damage characteristic of the bearer’s melee weapons.

enhancements.name: Tactical Alchemy
enhancements.description: KÂHL model only. In your Command phase, if the bearer’s unit is within range of one or more objective markers you control that are not within your deployment zone, you can spend 1YP. If you do, roll one D6: on a 4+, you gain 1CP.

enhancements.name: Trivärg Cyber Implant
enhancements.description: LEAGUES OF VOTANN model only. In your Shooting phase, each time the bearer’s unit is selected to shoot, if it disembarked from a TRANSPORT this turn, or if you spend 2YP, until the end of the phase, ranged weapons equipped by models in that unit have the [SUSTAINED HITS 2] ability.

enhancements.name: Precursive Judgement
enhancements.description: KÂHL model only. While the bearer’s unit is wholly within 6" of one or more friendly LEAGUES OF VOTANN TRANSPORT units, you can target the bearer’s unit with the Fire Overwatch Stratagem for 0CP and hits are scored on unmodified Hit rolls of 5+ while resolving that Stratagem.

enhancements.name: Signature Restoration
enhancements.description: IRON‑MASTER model only. Each time a friendly LEAGUES OF VOTANN model is repaired using the bearer’s Forgewrought Expertise ability, that model regains 1 additional lost wound.

enhancements.name: Fârstryder Node
enhancements.description: IRON‑MASTER or MEMNYR STRATEGIST model only. Models in the bearer’s unit have the Deep Strike ability.

enhancements.name: Calculated Tenacity
enhancements.description: IRON‑MASTER or MEMNYR STRATEGIST model only. While the bearer is leading a unit, add 1 to the Objective Control characteristic of models in that unit.

enhancements.name: Mantle of Elders
enhancements.description: MEMNYR STRATEGIST model only. Each time the bearer’s unit is selected to shoot, if you spend YP using the Optimal Application Detachment rule when doing so, you can roll one D6: on a 2+, you gain 1YP.

enhancements.name: Graviton Vault
enhancements.description: IRON‑MASTER model only. In your Shooting phase, after the bearer has shot, and in the Fight phase, after the bearer has fought, select one enemy MONSTER or VEHICLE unit hit by one or more of those attacks. Until the start of your next turn, that enemy unit is suppressed. While a unit is suppressed, each time a model in that unit makes an attack, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.

rule.text:
If your Army Faction is **LEAGUES OF VOTANN**, each time an enemy unit destroys a **LEAGUES OF VOTANN** unit from your army, that enemy unit gains 1 Judgement token. An enemy unit can never have more than 2 Judgement tokens (any further Judgement tokens a unit would gain beyond this are ignored).

Each time a model from your army with this ability makes an attack that targets a unit that has one or more Judgement tokens, until that model’s attacks have been resolved, apply the relevant bonus from the table below to that attack.

In addition, at the start of the battle, select two units from your opponent’s army; each of those units start the battle with 2 Judgement tokens.

**Designer’s Note**: If a unit with Judgement tokens is removed from the battlefield, make a note of how many Judgement tokens it had when it was removed. If that unit is set up on the battlefield again, place the corresponding number of Judgement tokens next to it. If a unit with Judgement tokens splits up into two or more smaller units, each of those units gains a number of Judgement tokens equal to that of the original unit. If two units combine to form a single larger unit and either of those units had Judgement tokens, make a note of how many the unit with the most has, just before they combine – the new unit has a number of Judgement tokens equal to this.

Each time a **LEAGUES OF VOTANN** model from your army makes an attack with a weapon (excluding Blast weapons) that targets the closest eligible target or a target that is within Engagement Range of that model’s unit:

■ Re‐roll a Hit roll of 1.
■ If your unit is a **KÂHL**, **EINHYR HEARTHGUARD** or **ÛTHAR THE DESTINED** unit, improve the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1.

At the start of the battle, select an additional number of units from your opponent’s army depending on the battle size, as shown below:

■ **Incursion**: 1 unit
■ **Strike Force**: 2 units
■ **Onslaught**: 4 units

Each of those units start the battle with 2 Judgement tokens (see Eye of the Ancestors).

If, at the start of any of your Command phases, any of those units have been destroyed, you gain a number of CP depending on how early in the battle you destroyed it, as shown below (you can only gain CP in this way once per battle, and CP gained in this way are an exemption to the Core Rules that limit the maximum number of CP you can gain per battle round to 1).

stratagems.name: Wall of Steel
stratagems.target: That IRONKIN STEELJACKS unit.
stratagems.when: Your Charge phase, just after an IRONKIN STEELJACKS unit from your army ends a Charge move.
stratagems.effect: Each time you use this Stratagem, you can spend 2YP. Select one enemy unit (excluding MONSTERS and VEHICLES) within Engagement Range of your unit and roll one D6 for each model in your unit, rolling two additional D6 if you spent YP during this use of this Stratagem: for each 4+, that enemy unit suffers 1 mortal wound (to a maximum of 6 mortal wounds).
stratagems.fluff: Ironkin Steeljacks use their indomitable strength and bulk on the charge to crush enemy infantry in brutal, mechanised body slams.

stratagems.name: Ranger Tactics
stratagems.target: One LEAGUES OF VOTANN unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
stratagems.when: Your Shooting phase.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack, if that attack targets an assailed unit and/or if your unit has the HERNKYN keyword, you can re‑roll the Hit roll.
stratagems.fluff: Foes thrown into disarray by the Hernkyn offer a vulnerability that is swiftly exploited.

stratagems.name: Frontier Momentum
stratagems.target: One HERNKYN unit from your army that has not been selected to move this phase.
stratagems.when: Your Movement phase.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, if your unit Advances, do not make an Advance roll for it. Instead, until the end of the phase, add 6" to the Move characteristic of models in your unit.
stratagems.fluff: Beyond the frontiers of kindred territory, survival depends upon swiftness of thought and action.

stratagems.name: Exposed Flaws
stratagems.target: One HERNKYN unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
stratagems.when: Your Shooting phase.
stratagems.effect: Each time you use this Stratagem, you can spend 2YP. Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack, if you spent YP during this use of this Stratagem and/or if that attack targets an assailed unit, you can re‑roll the Wound roll.
stratagems.fluff: Attuned to discerning imperfections in possible resources, Hernkyn soon spot weaknesses in their foes and are just as swift to profit from them.

stratagems.name: Honour of the Hold
stratagems.target: One LEAGUES OF VOTANN unit from your army that has not been selected to fight this phase.
stratagems.when: Fight phase.
stratagems.effect: Each time you use this Stratagem, you can spend 3YP. Select one enemy unit within Engagement Range of your unit. Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes a melee attack that targets that enemy unit, improve the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1. If you spent YP during this use of this Stratagem, improve the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 2 instead.
stratagems.fluff: A kinhost’s warriors take great pride in their combat proficiency as a symbol of their hold’s honour. The drive to cleave their foes apart is given greater impetus in pursuit of their kindred’s needs.

stratagems.name: Ancestral Sentence
stratagems.target: One LEAGUES OF VOTANN unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
stratagems.when: Your Shooting phase.
stratagems.effect: Each time you use this Stratagem, you can spend 3YP. Until the end of the phase, ranged weapons equipped by models in your unit have the [SUSTAINED HITS 1] ability. If you spent YP during this use of this Stratagem, until the end of the phase, those weapons have the [SUSTAINED HITS 2] ability instead.
stratagems.fluff: Some foes are so loathed that their ancestors are told to pass a sentence upon them. Marked for death, these enemies suffer the undiluted wrath of the Kin.

stratagems.name: HunTR’s Mark
stratagems.target: One LEAGUES OF VOTANN unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
stratagems.when: Your Shooting phase.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack, re‑roll a Hit roll of 1 and re‑roll a Wound roll of 1.
stratagems.fluff: Sensor‑network calibration tied to the HunTR modules on Kin weaponry can partly automate targeting to ensure the uncompromising judgement of the Votann is carried out without fail.

stratagems.name: Cyberstimm Infusion
stratagems.target: One CTHONIAN BESERKS unit from your army that has not been selected to fight this phase.
stratagems.when: Fight phase.
stratagems.effect: Each time you use this Stratagem, you can spend 2YP. Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack, re‑roll a Wound roll of 1. If you spent YP during this use of this Stratagem, you can re‑roll the Wound roll instead.
stratagems.fluff: The subdermal shunts of Cthonian Beserks can flood their bodies with stimulant chemicals. So empowered, they can smash through the toughest of enemies as easily as an obdurate ore seam.

stratagems.name: Brëkkeknots
stratagems.target: One KÂHL, ÛTHAR THE DESTINED or EINHYR HEARTHGUARD unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
stratagems.when: Your opponent’s Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, models in your unit have a 4+ invulnerable save.
stratagems.fluff: These micro shield generators, worked into warrior jewellery or armour crests, trigger on command to provide short‑lived boosted protection.

stratagems.name: Fury of the Hearth
stratagems.target: One EINHYR HEARTHGUARD unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
stratagems.when: Your Shooting phase.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, ranged weapons (excluding Blast weapons) equipped by models in your unit have the [RAPID FIRE 1] ability.
stratagems.fluff: As though they unleash the raging flames of their kindred’s hearth upon the enemy, the Einhyr all but drown their enemies in fire.

stratagems.name: Bastion Running
stratagems.target: One HEKATON LAND FORTRESS unit from your army that has not been selected to move this phase.
stratagems.when: Your Movement phase.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, each time your unit makes a Normal or Advance move, it can move horizontally through terrain features.
stratagems.fluff: A Hekaton Land Fortress can be temporarily rigged by its crew for bastion running. They fortify its systems to provide a brief power surge, allowing the tank to smash its way through hostile environments.

stratagems.name: Unwavering Accuracy
stratagems.target: One BRÔKHYR THUNDERKYN unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
stratagems.when: Your Shooting phase.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack, you can ignore any or all modifiers to the following: that attack’s Ballistic Skill characteristic; the Hit roll; the Wound roll; that attack’s Armour Penetration characteristic.
stratagems.fluff: Besides offering stable fire platforms, exoframes have multiple targeting and sensor subsystems that cut through foes’ duplicitous evasion.

stratagems.name: Superior Craftsmanship
stratagems.target: One LEAGUES OF VOTANN unit from your army that has not been selected to fight this phase.
stratagems.when: Fight phase.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack that targets a MONSTER or VEHICLE unit, add 1 to the Damage characteristic of that attack.
stratagems.fluff: Not only are the finest of the Kindred’s warriors selected for this duty, but they are also equipped with the best weaponry and wargear the Brôkhyr can produce.

stratagems.name: First Concern
stratagems.target: That BRÔKHYR, IRONKIN STEELJACKS or ARKANYST EVALUATOR unit.
stratagems.when: Your Shooting phase, just after a BRÔKHYR, IRONKIN STEELJACKS or ARKANYST EVALUATOR unit from your army has shot.
stratagems.effect: If your unit Remained Stationary in your Movement phase this turn, it can make a Normal move.
stratagems.fluff: Only after executing their prepared firing solutions will the kinhost’s heaviest gun lines move on, dispassionately assessing their next target.

stratagems.name: Preventative Purge
stratagems.target: One BRÔKHYR THUNDERKYN or IRONKIN STEELJACKS unit from your army.
stratagems.when: Your opponent’s Movement phase, just after an enemy unit ends a Fall Back move.
stratagems.effect: Your unit can shoot as if it were your Shooting phase. When doing so, models in your unit can only target that enemy unit (and only if it is an eligible target) and each time a model in your unit makes an attack, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.
stratagems.fluff: Using their strength and rapid target acquisition subroutines to alter fire arcs swiftly, Thunderkyn and Steeljacks are skilled in focusing on escaping foes that might pose a future threat.

stratagems.name: Cogitated Need
stratagems.target: One IRONKIN STEELJACKS unit from your army.
stratagems.when: End of your opponent’s Movement phase.
stratagems.effect: Your unit can make a Normal move. When doing so, your unit must end that move as close as possible to the closest objective marker.
stratagems.fluff: Focused on aiding their kindred to the best of their abilities, Ironkin Steeljacks locked onto an identified asset will push onward regardless of obstacles.

stratagems.name: Claimstaker Reflex
stratagems.target: One LEAGUES OF VOTANN unit from your army (excluding ARTILLERY and VEHICLE units) that is within 9" of that enemy unit.
stratagems.when: Your opponent’s Movement phase, just after an enemy unit ends a Normal, Advance or Fall Back move.
stratagems.effect: Each time you use this Stratagem, you can spend 2YP. Your unit can make a Normal move of up to D6". If you spent YP during this use of this Stratagem, your unit can make a Normal move of up to 6" instead.
stratagems.restrictions: A unit cannot embark within a TRANSPORT as part of this move.
stratagems.fluff: The instinct to seize the most advantageous and dominating positions is ingrained in the Kin.

stratagems.name: Dispersed Formation
stratagems.target: One LEAGUES OF VOTANN INFANTRY or LEAGUES OF VOTANN MOUNTED unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
stratagems.when: Your opponent’s Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, your unit has the Stealth ability and each time a ranged attack targets your unit, models in your unit have the Benefit of Cover against that attack.
stratagems.fluff: A prospect’s warriors will efficiently scatter to minimise the threat of concerted enemy fire.

stratagems.name: Adaptable Avarice
stratagems.target: One LEAGUES OF VOTANN CHARACTER unit from your army.
stratagems.when: Start of any phase, if units from your army have Fortify Takeover.
stratagems.effect: Each time you use this Stratagem, you can spend any number of YP. Once you have done so, if you have 6 or fewer YP, until the start of your next turn, units from your army have Hostile Acquisition instead.
stratagems.fluff: When opportunity catches the eye of a prospect’s commander, they will readily resume a rapid and aggressive footing.

stratagems.name: Ordered Retreat
stratagems.target: That LEAGUES OF VOTANN unit.
stratagems.when: Your Movement phase, just after a LEAGUES OF VOTANN unit from your army Falls Back.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the turn, your unit is eligible to shoot and declare a charge in a turn in which it Fell Back.
stratagems.fluff: Not for the Kin the sudden panic of the rout. Instead, they fall back steadily and by squads, laying down suppressing fire while preparing fresh assaults.

stratagems.name: Unstoppable Force
stratagems.target: One LEAGUES OF VOTANN unit from your army that has not been selected to fight this phase.
stratagems.when: Fight phase.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, each time your unit Piles In or Consolidates, each model in that unit can move up to 6" instead of up to 3".
stratagems.fluff: With their enemies within reach, the Kin’s fury and momentum become an elemental force that will not be stayed.

stratagems.name: Augmented Assault
stratagems.target: One CTHONIAN BESERKS unit from your army that has not been selected to move this phase.
stratagems.when: Your Movement phase.
stratagems.effect: Each time you use this Stratagem, you can spend up to 2YP. Until the end of the turn, add X" to the Move characteristic of models in your unit, where X is the number of YP you spent during this use of this Stratagem, and your unit is eligible to declare a charge in a turn in which it Advanced.
stratagems.fluff: The profusion of bionic augmentations that Beserks possess can grant them a burst of incredible speed, one that can drive them – a guttural war song on their lips – into their reeling foes like a meteor.

stratagems.name: Tectonic Fracture
stratagems.target: That CTHONIAN EARTHSHAKERS unit.
stratagems.when: Your Shooting phase, just after a CTHONIAN EARTHSHAKERS unit from your army has shot.
stratagems.effect: Each time you use this Stratagem, you can spend 2YP. Select one enemy unit hit by one or more of your unit’s attacks this phase. Until the start of your next Shooting phase, subtract 2 from that unit’s Move characteristic and, if you spent YP during this use of this Stratagem, subtract 2 from Charge rolls made for that unit.
stratagems.fluff: Skilled Cthonian gunners can initiate localised quakes and pressure waves of such intensity that foes struggle to retain their impetus.

stratagems.name: Weavewërke Buttress
stratagems.target: One LEAGUES OF VOTANN INFANTRY unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
stratagems.when: Your opponent’s Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets, if units from your army have Hostile Acquisition.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack targets your unit, subtract 1 from the Wound roll.
stratagems.fluff: Every dêlve is threaded with force fields to shield against catastrophe, a protection that can be tapped in battle to support advances into hostile territory.

stratagems.name: Hidden Acessways
stratagems.target: One CTHONIAN BESERKS, HEARTHKYN WARRIORS or HERNKYN YAEGIRS unit from your army that is not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units.
stratagems.when: End of your opponent’s Fight phase.
stratagems.effect: Remove your unit from the battlefield and place it into Strategic Reserves.
stratagems.fluff: A guild’s elite can swiftly reenter the dêlve’s labyrinth, slipping into an artfully hidden tunnel or activating site‑to‑site teleports, ready to attack elsewhere at a moment’s notice.

stratagems.name: Sure of Purpose
stratagems.target: One LEAGUES OF VOTANN unit from your army that has not been selected to fight this phase.
stratagems.when: Fight phase.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes a Pile‑in or Consolidation move, it can move up to 6" instead of up to 3".
stratagems.fluff: The single‑minded advance of the Kin rolls over collapsing enemy lines and exploits every fault and weakness, driving on towards the objective.

stratagems.name: Unyielding Aggression
stratagems.target: That LEAGUES OF VOTANN INFANTRY unit.
stratagems.when: Your Movement phase, just after a LEAGUES OF VOTANN INFANTRY unit from your army Falls Back.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the turn, your unit is eligible to shoot and declare a charge in a turn in which it Fell Back.
stratagems.fluff: Even should they be compelled to pull back momentarily, the warriors of the Hearthband maintain a punishing curtain of fire to erode the enemy further or rally swiftly and drive back into the fight.

stratagems.name: Materialisation Matrices
stratagems.target: One LEAGUES OF VOTANN unit from your army that is in Reserves and has the Deep Strike ability.
stratagems.when: The Reinforcements step of your Movement phase.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, when your unit is set up on the battlefield using the Deep Strike ability, it can be set up anywhere on the battlefield that is more than 6" horizontally away from all enemy units.
stratagems.restrictions: Until the end of the turn, your unit is not eligible to declare a charge.
stratagems.fluff: Built to a superior standard using secrets imparted by the Votann, the teleporters employed by this Hearthband can stabilise rematerialisation fields remarkably close to the foe.

stratagems.name: Secure Positions
stratagems.target: One LEAGUES OF VOTANN TRANSPORT unit from your army.
stratagems.when: End of any phase, if units from your army have Hostile Acquisition.
stratagems.effect: One LEAGUES OF VOTANN unit embarked within your TRANSPORT can disembark. When doing so, models in that unit can be set up anywhere on the battlefield wholly within 6" of your TRANSPORT.
stratagems.fluff: While there are resources to secure, the Kin will seize any opportunity to effect a rapid and ordered deployment to establish defensive positions.

stratagems.name: Inexorable Efficiency
stratagems.target: One LEAGUES OF VOTANN unit from your army.
stratagems.when: Your Shooting phase.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, your unit is eligible to shoot in a turn in which it Fell Back.
stratagems.fluff: With the wealth of sensor‑wrought information they can access, the Kin can efficiently adapt fighting withdrawals into deadly counterattacks.

stratagems.name: Opportunistic Escalation
stratagems.target: One LEAGUES OF VOTANN VEHICLE unit from your army (excluding HEKATON LAND FORTRESS units) that was hit by one or more of those attacks.
stratagems.when: Your opponent’s Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has shot, if units from your army have Hostile Acquisition.
stratagems.effect: Your unit can make a Normal move of up to D6".
stratagems.fluff: Even amid heavy incoming fire, the crew of a kinhost’s lighter vehicles can make rapid manoeuvres to exploit sudden openings.

stratagems.name: Reactive Reprisal
stratagems.target: One LEAGUES OF VOTANN unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
stratagems.when: Your opponent’s Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has shot, if units from your army have Fortify Takeover.
stratagems.effect: Your unit can shoot as if it were your Shooting phase, only that enemy unit when doing so, and can only do so if that enemy unit is an eligible target.
stratagems.fluff: Once prizes have been seized, the Kin focus their efforts upon maximising their control and respond with redoubled fury to attempts to loosen their grip.

stratagems.name: Vengeance Flare
stratagems.target: One LEAGUES OF VOTANN INFANTRY unit that was hit by one or more of those attacks.
stratagems.when: Your opponent’s Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has shot.
stratagems.effect: Each time you use this Stratagem, you can spend 2YP. Select one friendly KAPRICUS or SAGITAUR unit within 6" of your INFANTRY unit. If you spent YP during this use of this Stratagem, you can select one friendly HEKATON LAND FORTRESS unit within 6" of your INFANTRY unit instead. The selected unit can shoot as if it were your Shooting phase. When doing so, models in the selected unit can only target that enemy unit (and only if it is an eligible target).
stratagems.fluff: With a narrow‑band data burst, those of an oathband who have been wronged can call in the devastating vengeance of their armoured support.

stratagems.name: Delayed-Fire Rounds
stratagems.target: That BRÔKHYR, IRONKIN STEELJACKS or ARKANYST EVALUATOR unit.
stratagems.when: Your Shooting phase, just after a BRÔKHYR, IRONKIN STEELJACKS or ARKANYST EVALUATOR unit from your army has shot.
stratagems.effect: Select one enemy unit (excluding MONSTERS and VEHICLES) hit by one or more of those attacks. Until the start of your next Shooting phase, each time that enemy unit makes a Normal, Advance or Fall Back move, roll one D6 for each model in that unit: for each 1, that unit suffers 1 mortal wound (to a maximum of 6 mortal wounds).
stratagems.fluff: Exotic munitions can seed enemy lines with slow‑release death, stalling those who neutralise the threat while ravaging any who push on.

stratagems.name: Void Hardened
stratagems.target: One LEAGUES OF VOTANN unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
stratagems.when: Your opponent’s Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets, if units from your army have Fortify Takeover.
stratagems.effect: Until the attacking unit has finished making its attacks, each time an attack targets your unit, worsen the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1.
stratagems.fluff: Between their resilient armour and technology and their capacity to stoically endure pain and suffering, the Kin can weather devastating attacks.

stratagems.name: Illuminated Priority
stratagems.target: That LEAGUES OF VOTANN VEHICLE unit.
stratagems.when: Your Shooting phase, just after a LEAGUES OF VOTANN VEHICLE unit from your army has shot.
stratagems.effect: Select one enemy unit hit by one or more of those attacks. Until the end of the phase, each time a LEAGUES OF VOTANN INFANTRY model from your army makes an attack that targets that enemy unit, re‑roll a Hit roll of 1.
stratagems.fluff: Using specialised beam emission signatures, multispectral ammunition, or broadcasting targeting data, the gunnery crews of Kin war engines can signify priority targets for their comrades.
